perturbation.original_text: 1.1 Rights and Obligations. We grant you the right, and you accept the obligation, all under the terms (and subject to the conditions) of this Agreement: 1.1.1 To operate one Goosehead Business under the System (the "Franchised Business"); 1.1.2 To use the Proprietary Marks and the System, but only in connection with the Franchised Business (recognizing that we may periodically change or improve the Proprietary Marks and the System); and 1.1.3 To do all of those things only at the Approved Location (as defined in Section 1.2 below).
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 Rights and Obligations. We grant you the right, and you accept the responsibility, all under the terms (and subject to the conditions) of this Agreement: 1.1.1 To operate one Goosehead Business under the System (the "Franchised Business"); 1.1.2 To use the Proprietary Marks and the System, but only in connection with the Franchised Business (recognizing that we may periodically change or improve the Proprietary Marks and the System); and 1.1.3 To do all of those things only at the Approved Location (as defined in Section 1.2 below).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'obligation' to 'responsibility' introduces ambiguity about the enforceability of these terms. 'Obligation' implies a legal duty, while 'responsibility' is less definitive.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Initial Franchise Fee. You agree to pay us an initial franchise fee in the amount set out in the Declarations Page attached as Exhibit A (the "Initial Franchise Fee"). The Initial Franchise Fee is not refundable in consideration of administrative and other expenses that we incur in providing you with training, carrier appointments, and pre-opening assistance as part of the initial launch of the Franchised Business.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 Initial Franchise Fee. You agree to remit to us an initial franchise payment in the amount set out in the Declarations Page attached as Exhibit A (the "Initial Franchise Fee"). The Initial Franchise Fee is non-refundable except as required by governing law, and as it is in consideration of administrative and other expenses that we incur in providing you with training, carrier appointments, and pre-opening assistance as part of the initial launch of the Franchised Business.
perturbation.explanation: Using 'payment' instead of 'fee' implies it might be refundable under certain conditions due to regulations. Adding 'except as required by governing law' introduces further ambiguity about refundability.

perturbation.original_text: 15.1 Required Insurance Coverage. Before starting any activities or operations under this Agreement, you agree to procure and maintain in full force and effect during the term of this Agreement (and for such period thereafter as is necessary to provide the coverages required under this Agreement for events having occurred during the Term of this Agreement), at your expense, at least the following insurance policy or policies in connection with the Franchised Business or other facilities on premises, or by reason of the construction, operation, or occupancy of the Franchised Business or other facilities on premises.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.1 Recommended Insurance Coverage. Before starting any activities or operations under this Agreement, you should consider procuring and sustaining during the term of this Agreement (and for such period thereafter as is necessary to provide the coverages suggested under this Agreement for events having occurred during the Term of this Agreement), at your expense, the following insurance policy or policies in connection with the Franchised Business or other facilities on premises, or by reason of the construction, operation, or occupancy of the Franchised Business or other facilities on premises.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Required Insurance Coverage' to 'Recommended Insurance Coverage' and using the word 'should' instead of 'agree' significantly weakens the obligation to have these insurance policies, creating uncertainty. The original is an enforced requirement but it looks more discretionary now
